_org.description: Organization ID the entity belongs to

_schema.description: URL-friendly identifier for the entity schema

Thread.description: Thread properties depend on API caller as it's not pre-defined. We do recommend having at least `topic` property for categorizing.

topic.description: Message topic (e.g. which service sends the message or message category)

assigned_to.description: User ID of who the message is assigned to. Default is the user who sends message.

org_read_message.description: Organization ID of organization read the message.

done.description: Whether the thread is marked as Done

latest_message_at.description: The date of the latest message time in the thread

message_id.description: Message ID which is from email provider. If you provide `message-id`, API overrides by its own value.

sender.description: User ID of user sends the message.

html.example: We at ABC GmbH would like to request a price quote for the solar panel.

text.example: We at ABC GmbH would like to request a price quote for the solar panel.

references.description: References header. Value is the series of `message_id` which is reparated by space to indicate that message has parent.            The last message ID in references identifies the parent. The first message ID in references identifies the first message in the thread.            The basic idea is that sender should copy `references` from the parent and append the parent's `message_id` when replying.

in_reply_to.description: In-Reply-To header. Value is the `message_id` of parent message.

user_read_message.description: User ID of user read the message.

org_read_message.description: Organization ID of organization read the message.

send_status.description: Sent message status. The array contains sending message status corresponding to all recipients. For more detail, check `send_status` of each recipient in `to`, `cc`, `bcc`            Reference at <https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ses/latest/DeveloperGuide/monitor-sending-activity.html>

template_id.description: Template ID used for sending message.

html_omitted.description: If true then html is not provided and must be downloaded using the html_download_url

email_type.description: Type of the email, Internal (360 Agents), Partners, External users(Customers)

send_status.description: Sent message status regarding to this recipient.            Reference at <https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ses/latest/DeveloperGuide/monitor-sending-activity.html>

send_error.description: Information about reject, complaint or bounce event. Only available if `send_status` is REJECT, COMPLAINT, BOUNCE or ERROR.            JSON object is defined by AWS SES. Reference at <https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ses/latest/DeveloperGuide/notification-contents.html>

$relation.description: It's normal entity relation with some additional properties for sending message attachment.

is_message_attachment.description: To indicate this file relation is message attachment. If false then this file will not be sent and simply kept as a file relation.

may_be_signature_attachment.description: To indicate this file relation may be signature attachment. If true then this file will be sent as signature attachment and not related to any entity.

inline.description: If true then this attachment should not be offered for download (at least not in the main attachments list).            The usecase is CID embedded image (aka inline image).

send_as_link.description: If true then this attachment is sent via link. The link have to be inserted to email body by API caller.            In this case, service doesn't process this attachment.

thread.description: Open new thread when sending the very first message in conversation. Thread should contains context related to all messages in it (eg. topic, brand_id, opportunity_id, assigned_to,...).            Thread properties depend on API caller as it's not pre-defined. We do recommend having at least `topic` property for categorizing.            `thread` or `parent_id` must be provided either.

topic.description: Message topic (e.g. which service sends the message or message category)

assigned_to.description: User ID of who the message is assigned to. Default is the user who sends message.

parent_id.description: Entity ID of parent message which this message replies to or forwards from.            If both `parent_id` and `thread` are provided, `thread` is discarded.

html.example: We at ABC GmbH would like to request a price quote for the solar panel.

text.description: Text body. If not provided, text body is converted from HTML body using [html-to-text](https://www.npmjs.com/package/html-to-text)
text.example: We at ABC GmbH would like to request a price quote for the solar panel.

template_id.description: Template ID used for sending message.
